page.title: 02THE WHITE HORSE OF BROADTOWN
page.content: The{White Horse}of{BroadTown}was cut in about{1864}by{Mr William Simmonds of{Littleton (LittleTown)}farm on the hills above{BroadTown}almost opposite the school.It measured eighty six feet in length by sixty one in height.Today it measures 24m long by 19.06m high. When scoured it used to be visible up to twenty miles away.By{1936}the horse was in a really bad state and the lower part of the legs had been lost.It is shown in a{trotting {posistion.}Now the horse has no{chalk left on it and it has almost disappeared.About two years ago some of the villagers including children helped to tidy it up.It still remains but never white.
